description: This first course in systems modeling focuses on linear discrete-time systems. We draw on a set of examples used throughout the course as the necessary mathematical tools are developed. The examples demonstrate the breadth of systems models and are drawn from engineering, the biological sciences, and economics. MATLAB will be used extensively.
name: INTRO TO DYNAMIC SYSTEMS

values.comments:
This first course in systems modeling focuses on linear discrete-time systems. We draw on a set of examples used throughout the course as the necessary mathematical tools are developed. The examples demonstrate the breadth of systems models and are drawn from engineering, the biological sciences, and economics. MATLAB will be used extensively.

Students reported learning a lot about “mathematical theory” and its “applications in electrical engineering,” but many felt the course was structured more like a math course than an engineering course. While most students found the class “engaging” and “interesting,” many also found the course material to be “repetitive” and “inapplicable” to real-life scenarios, especially compared against Math 240.

Students found Dr. Keenan to be “enthusiastic” and generally “helpful and accessible.” Students reported that Dr. Keenan’s slides were generally more useful than the textbook or problem sets, but maintained that review sessions and in-class questions were generally helpful in preparing for exams, though homework was not always so.

Many students reported being unsure why the course was incorporated as a requirement for the EE degree. All students were in either ESE or EE, and most students maintained that a lot of outside work was necessary to achieve success in the course. However, many students agreed that the homework assignments were generally not indicative of exam problems and also noted that practice tests had no solutions, making it sometimes difficult to study when it was not possible to go to review sessions. In general, the consensus seemed to be that the course was moderately difficult.
